note.p: Death: Solebay, off Southwold, Suffolk (28 May 1672)
Burial: St Edmund's Chapel, Westminster Abbey, London

Career: Gentleman of the Privy Chamber (1664-1669, 1671-death); Captain in the Royal Navy (1665-1667, 1672); Captain of the 'Antelope', 'Henrietta' (1666) and 'Cambridge' (1667, 1672); lost an arm in the Four Days' Battle (1666); Captain, 2nd Foot Guards (1667-1669); his troop was taken away and he offered his services, in vain, to Louis XIV; MP for Grimsby (1667-1672); Mayor of Grimsby (1669-1670); killed at the Battle of Solebay; his will left nothing to his father or wife but left money for the erection of a memorial to himself in Westminster Abbey
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Henning; MT
